a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Number of tracked objects in low Earth orbit, by type
Objects are subtracted from the time series after they have reentered the Earth's atmosphere. Not all objects are
tracked: in 2021, the European Space Agency estimated there were more than 130 million space debris objects
Note: Low Earth orbit is defined by a point of closest approach to Earth below 2,000 kilometers. Debris are assigned to the launch date of the
original object from which they were separated.
Data source: United States Space Force (2023)
